when I changed a few things around. :)

On 12/28/11, Sandy <magicquartz@...> wrote:
> Just today, one of my friends on Yahoo mail had their account broken into
> and me and my friends received the fraudulent email.  Apparently there is a
> rash of accounts being broken into on yahoo.   Before it happens to you,
> there is something you can do to prevent intrusion.   And here it is:
>
> 1:  Sign into your account info.
>
> 2: Scroll down to SECOND SIGN IN VERIFICATION.
>
> 3: Click on that, it will send you a verification number and give you the
> option
> Of sending that number to another email, other than yahoo, or through your
> mobile phone, which is ten times safer by the way.
>
> 4:  If you have a mobile number, click on the option to just send it through
> there rather than the email.
>
> 5:  The verification code will need to be verified on the computer.  Type
> the number exactly how it was sent to you and then you're done.
>
> What this will do is make it impossible for hackers to access your account.
> If they try an unauthorized login they will fail miserably.  There's more
> info related to this in your account profile section.  It's really worth the
> time investment.
>
>
